UPDATE FOR 2019

So, welcome to 2019 bois. And I'm here to write an entirely new review.

Always remember to:
1. Bring someone on your Friend List to party.
2. STAY NEAR THE CART IF YOU'RE IN BLU (Payload mode).
3. WEAR A HAT! Even if it's "Proof of Purchase"
4. Pyro & Engineer, Medic & Heavy, they're best buddies. Feel free to add more (including the gears in the comments section)
5. (don't follow this one) UNLEASH YOUR WEEB


C.C.'s verdict: A- as in "A chaotic battlefield which boring without friends. Don't forget to wear a hat!"

I'm so good at Team Fortress 2 that I'll just queue for casual, not pay attention at all, and top score. However on the flip side my team is so bad that even when I fully try hard we still lose at first. You see this is the true balance of Team Fortress 2. As you get better you will notice more and more the complete idiocy and incompetency that your team exudes "it truly boggles the mind how stupid people can be" you think to yourself, then you die to a 5 year old kid who just installed. No matter how many hours you have or how good you think you are, you are still garbage.
Taunts, Hats this game is dying without them :)

Really lovely game. I recommend getting into it tho be prepared to watch lots of Youtube tutorials.

Critique: At the base this game is a masterpiece and it's my favorite game ever but the way valve handles it isn't great at all.

1. This is the biggest and most important issue. Valve treats tf2 horribly: https://youtu.be/lLezXut_Uxg and https://youtu.be/g4S4-ncj6L0

2. It's really hard to get into tf2 as a new player: https://youtu.be/hj6duP3Ynt0

3. The default settings are pretty damn bad:  https://youtu.be/LSUtkj3YidQ and https://youtu.be/rRxFpr5Javg

4. Bot infested servers.

5. The hats kinda break the artstyle: https://youtu.be/S1W8BZPf-N8

An important thing to note is that I do not blame the tf2 team for these issues. I blame valve. This game is beautiful and is something I'm incredibly invested in. Please valve. ;w;

A solution for tf2?: The way valve currently treat their games is sad and destructive to their communities. Either valve fixes a their problems or tf2 moves owners. The issue with both of these are that they are both incredibly unrealistic. For valve changing they don't really have financial reason to do so and for  Tf2 moving owners valve would only sell Tf2 for an incredible amount of money which most good game studios just wouldn't be able to afford. 

I currently don't see a future where Tf2 will get what it needs, tho. I don't think this will stop tf2 from staying alive and strong the base of this game is incredibly well made and the community is amazing in terms of how much work they put into this game.

At the end of the day Tf2 is a game I'd recommend to basically anyone. It's a game which once you past a certain stage you can really experience the beauty of it.



Tldr: Valve bad, Tf2 great

I highly reccommend this game. My girlfriend told me to try it out, I was a little effy about at the beginning but it was so much fun. I've been trying to get my friends to play steam games lately and this is one of the games I reccomend them to play.

A variety of classes to choose! Fun gameplay! Tons of weapons! Friendly moments! Hoovies! Spycrabs! HATS! Demopans! Gmod/SFM Videos!! and more for just one click in "Play Game" above!
Beware the W+M1's and pubs Tryhards, Trickstabs and Facestabs, Backburner Pyros, Soldiers with Pocket Girlfriends, Bind Spammers and the worst of them all.... Aimbot Snipers!!
All this things togheter in one Free to Play game!
(For the best experience get yourself Premium to join the wonders of the complex trading system this game has. Results may vary depending on the server that you join.  Being Premium/Having Hats don't ensure skilled gameplay. This product may cause serious addiction. We don't take responsibilities for the issues that this game can produce. Always remember to praise Lord Gaben.)
